intro: Athanasia dimorpha, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant has two distinct leaf forms, which is reflected in its scientific name "dimorpha," meaning two forms. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Athanasia dimorpha is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
